reviews.review_msg: Giltrow worshiper! Erratic person.She could be funny & happy and then just lose it.She went off on a student in class-stopping their presentation to argue with them because she had a differing opionion,creating an INCREDIBLY awkward environment to be in.She was so flaky & disorganized,and her attitude made it incredibly hard to want to go to class.
Good prof, makes dry material relatively interesting with good examples.  Is VERY helpful if students don't understand the material.

One of the BEST Profs this school has!  Challenges you while going above and beyond to help you succeed! She genuinly cares about each student, rare for an undergrad prof. She gives good marks but she inspires you to work for them. I worked harder in her class than I ever have before and I enjoyed every minute of it.

She is not afraid to give high marks to everyone in the class. She is more worried about how much you learn and improve, the grade to her is secondary. She is the best essay marker I have ever had and is SOOO helpful - she really goes out of her way to help you.  This class will make you a better writier

Probably the best prof at SFU. He cares very deeply at SFU and gives really great feedback if you meet up with him to discuss your exams/essays. His lectures are so entertaining and have so much information so as long as you show up to lectures, you really don't need to study or anything. Don't skip the lectures, they're so worth it.

I took my first English class (Engl 211) with him and It's fair to say he is an outstanding prof. His lectures provide great insight into the text and prepare you well for his assignments/exams. He cares very deeply about his students. We had a late exam and he waited at the bus stop for every student to safely board the bus.

Sarcastic, funny, intelligent and incredibly good looking. Definitely worth taking this class despite the fact that he and his TAs were all hard markers. Poems were interesting and discussion was encouraged, go to office hours and you'll be fine.

I loved Jon's lectures because he is so knowledgeable about American history and made everything very digestible with humour and anecdotes. Very straightforward essays and final exam. 5 required texts, but they were all super interesting! Show up and take good notes and you will be good!

Jon is one of the best lecturers I've ever had the privilege of listening to. Surprisingly, he doesn't like the lecture format himself, but he's an incredible speaker. His lectures were incredibly insightful and invaluable when it came to studying alone. He really knows his stuff and I hope I will get to take another course with him.

Professor Smith is definitely a good prof, but not because he's nice to you. He's very funny, but the reason he's such an excellent prof is that he genuinely works towards teaching students applicable skills rather than handing them answers and analysis. Thus, you will receive lower grades than usual, because he will make you show those skills off.
Aproachable, helpul, friendly & informative. Engaging and unique teaching tactics,  Distracting smile& Good sense of humor. not a bad way to spend a couple in-class hours
